title: Java Basics Quiz - (Tracing & Operators)
description: Take this quiz to assess how well you can trace Java code. It includes arithmetic operators, logical operators, evaluation order, and expression results.

multipleChoice.question:
What is printed?
System.out.println(10 - 4 * 2 + 6 / 3);

What is output?
int x = 3 * 2 + 4 / 2 - 1;
Which operator has highest precedence?

What is printed?
System.out.println(15 / 4);

What is printed?
System.out.println(15 / 4.0);

What prints?
System.out.println((5 > 3) && (8 < 2));

What is printed?
System.out.println(9 % 4 * 2);

What is printed?
System.out.println(4 + 3 + "Hello" + 2 + 1);

Evaluate:
System.out.println(4 * (2 + 3) / 2);

trueFalse.question: The ++ prefix changes the value before the expression is evaluated.
Logical OR (||) stops evaluating once a true value is found.
x += y * 2 is the same as x = x + (y * 2).
The ternary operator selects between two values.
Mixing int and double in operations results in double output.
Division by zero using integers causes a runtime error.
x++ increases x before using it in the expression.
